definition: The correspondence between an AI system's observable behavior and intended objectives, ensuring that the system's actions produce outcomes that match the goals specified by its designers or users, regardless of the system's internal representations or motivations.

positive_examples: This is an example of outer alignment.
The outer alignment demonstrated clear characteristics.
We observed outer alignment in this context.
A typical case of outer alignment would involve these features.
The concept of outer alignment applies here.
The process of specifying reward functions or training objectives that accurately capture human values and intentions.
negative_examples: This is an example of non deceptive alignment, not outer alignment.
This represents a i alignment process in general.
The document was filed in the cabinet.
She walked to the store to buy groceries.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: NonDeceptiveAlignment, or other types of AIAlignmentProcess
